snippet: Rachel Noerdlinger, the chief of staff to Mayor Bill de Blasio’s wife, Chirlane McCray, may not have disclosed that she lives with a boyfriend with a criminal record.
abstract: New York City investigators open inquiry into Rachel Noerdliner, chief of staff to Mayor Bill de Blasio's wife Chirlane McCray, over her failure to disclose during background check that she shares a home with her boyfriend Hassaun McFarlan, who has a criminal record; providing false or incomplete information on questionnaire required by city's Investigation Department can result in termination.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM, WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and NIKITA STEWART

lead_paragraph: Rachel Noerdlinger, the chief of staff to Mayor Bill de Blasio’s wife, Chirlane McCray, may not have disclosed that she lives with a boyfriend with a criminal record.

headline.main: New York City Said to Open Inquiry on Omission by First Lady’s Top Aide
headline.print_headline: City Said to Open Inquiry on Omission by Top Aide to First Lady
